techmeme.title: Dolby launches Dolby Vision 2, adding AI-powered Content Intelligence and Authentic Motion, first on Hisense TVs, over 10 years after launching Dolby Vision (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Microsoft says it agreed to give the US GSA $6B+ in potential savings on Office, Azure, 365, and other tools over three years, including $3.1B in the first year (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Internal data: Amazon registered 5.4M US Prime sign-ups over the 21-day run-up to Prime Day and the four-day event, ~116K less than 2024 and 106K below its goal (Greg Bensinger/Reuters)
A look at a16z's Speedrun, a YC-like accelerator targeting a more creative demographic; a16z invested $180M into 150 Speedrun companies over the last 18 months (Kate Clark/Bloomberg)
OpenAI details its plan to add guardrails for teens and people in emotional distress in the next 120 days, including routing conversations to GPT-5-thinking (Megan Morrone/Axios)
